1.q_string: Which of the following do not support coevolution?
Why do humans and chimpanzees share 98% of their genomes?
q_option: Because humans inherited genomes from chimpanzees
Because they have a common ancestor

1.q_string: In which period did the first mammals appear?
Experiment to prove that synthesis of organic compound formed the basis of life was performed by:
Two genetically different organisms show similar adaptations due to:
Who among the following suggested that life must have developed from simple inorganic molecule?
The mutation theory expaining organic evolution was proposed by:
The cranial capacity of Homo habilis was:
Who is popularly known as the father of Evolutionary Biology?
In the context of biology, the term adaptive radiation refers to:
q_option: the process of evolution of different species in a given geographical area starting from a point and radiating to other habitats.
the process by which the species in different geographical areas adapt to similar conditions of solar insolation.
the part of Photosynthetically Active Radiation (PAR) that is utilized by the primary producers and is available to the herbivores.
the emergence of a dominant species due to extinction of other species as a result of harmful radiation in an area.

1.q_string: Speciation is the formation of one or more new species from an existing species. A new species or organism is formed when?
q_option: A series of mutation occur so that an organism becomes different from the others in population, but it still shows successful interbreeding.
Climate changes drastically leading to structural changes in the given population.
A group of organisms isolated from the rest of the species by geographical barrier.

1.q_string:
Which of the following theories are related to the evolution of life?

A. The theory of natural selection

B. Mutation theory of evolution

C. Theory of inheritance of acquired characteristics

D. Theory of segregation
When comparing two animals, we can say they have analogous organs, if the organs ______.
q_option: perform different functions in both animals but are anatomically very similar
perform the same function in both animals but are anatomically very different
perform the same function in both animals
